data.title: tek 453 manual and p6047 probe
data.text:
Dale H. Cook

At 02:26 AM 6/10/2003 +0000, sundownerc23 wrote:

Hi, I bought a tek 453 at a hamfest, and it works!! Now I need a

manual and probe-P6047. Is there a source for free manuals or

copies? The dealers seem to think copies are rare books.

You need to know whether your serial number is below or above 20,000 - there are major differences between the two.

Manual Merchant is showing at least one original in stock at:

http://www.manualmerchant.com/tek4-9.htm

You would need to email them to see whether they have one to match your serial number. Their original manuals are usually not very much more expensive than the photocopies from Tannenbaum:

http://www.agtannenbaum.com/t_cat.html

or photocopies from Sarrio:

http://www.sarrio.com/sarrio/rsman3.html

Dale H. Cook, Chief Engineer, WWWR Roanoke VA, WCQV Moneta VA, WKBA WZZI Vinton VA, WKPA WLNI WZZU Lynchburg VA, WMNA / WMNA-FM Gretna VA

Star City Antique Radios and Test Equipment:

http://www.angelfire.com/ma4/oldcolony/radios/radtop.html

Don Black

Hi Sundowner, I've emailed the schematics for the 453 to you as three emails to

keep the file size down. I don't know if they match your series but hope they

help. Let me know if you receive all three emails OK or if there's a problem.

Don Black.
